incidents.name: Pricing Delays

incident_updates.body: The issue impacting our billing system that caused delayed pricing information for messages, calls, recordings, and transcriptions fetched via public API has been resolved.

Our billing system causing delayed pricing information for messages, calls, recordings, and transcriptions fetched via public API is now operating normally. We will continue to monitor to ensure full system stability. We'll provide another update on 2/19/2024 at 11:29 am PST or as soon as more information becomes available.

We continue to experience an issue with our billing system that is causing delayed pricing information for messages, calls, recordings, and transcriptions fetched via public API. We will provide another update in 16 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

We continue to experience an issue with our billing system that is causing delayed pricing information for messages, calls, recordings, and transcriptions fetched via public API. We will provide another update in 8 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

Our engineers have identified an issue with our billing system that is causing delayed pricing information for messages, calls, recordings, and transcriptions fetched via public API. Our engineers are working on deploying a fix. We expect to provide another update in 4 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

Our engineers have identified an issue with our billing system that is causing delays between calls, recordings, transcriptions transactions and pricing available via the public API. Our engineers are working on deploying a fix. We expect to provide another update in 2 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

Our engineers have identified  performance degrade  issues with our billing system that is causing a delay/mismatch between all product usage and tiered pricing. Our engineers have taken initial mitigation steps for the lag reduction and analyzing further for high throughput. We expect to provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available

Our monitoring systems have detected a potential issue with our billing systems. Our engineering team has been alerted and is actively investigating. We will update as soon as we have more information.

incidents.name: Twilio Rest API Errors Impacting Multiple Twilio Services

incident_updates.body: All services impacted by the issues with the Twilio Rest API have recovered and are operating as intended. This incident has been resolved.

We're seeing recovery in the Twilio Rest API, impacting multiple Twilio services. Please see impacted services as follows:

Taskrouter: Customers are unable to create, update, or delete via REST API
Flex platform: Agent Login/Inbound outbound conversation 
Programmable Video: Unable to create and modify rooms via Rest API 
Verify: Customers may have seen errors
Programmable Messaging (SMS): Customers may experience 5XX errors

We will be monitoring all services to ensure a full recovery and provide another update in 30 minutes or as soon as more information becomes available.

We are experiencing issues with the Twilio Rest API, impacting multiple Twilio services. We're seeing impact on Verify, Programmable Messaging (SMS), Taksrouter and Flex agent login/inbound conversations. Our engineering team is actively working to resolve the issue. We expect to provide another update in 30 mins or as soon as more information becomes available.

We are currently investigating errors for the Twilio Rest API, impacting multiple Twilio services. Our engineering team has been alerted and is actively investigating. We will update as soon as we have more information.

components.description: May be impacted by SMS delivery issues

incidents.name: Branded Calling Issues on T-Mobile

incident_updates.body: Branded calling on T-Mobile for a small set of customers was  degraded between 12:00 AM on 09/25/2023 and 11:00 AM  on 02/12/2024 Pacific Time. During this period of time, customers that called T-Mobile handsets were unable to see their brand displayed for some calls. The issue has now been resolved.

incidents.name: Super SIM Over the Air Update Delays

incident_updates.body: We are no longer experiencing Over-the-Air (OTA) update issue. This incident has been resolved.
We are now seeing recovery of the Over-the-Air (OTA) update issue. We are continuing to monitor for service stability. We will provide another update in 30 minutes.
We are now seeing recovery of the Over-the-Air (OTA) update issue. We are continuing to monitor for service stability. We will provide another update in 30 minutes.

We have identified a fix for the issue that is preventing some Super SIMs from successfully updating to their latest settings via over-the-air (OTA) updates. The fix needs to be implemented at one of our downstream partners, who expect to begin releasing the update to impacted SIMs as soon as possible. Afterwards, we expect to see fewer OTA updates failing to complete despite multiple attempts to contact the OTA service. Please note that it may take more than one attempt for a SIM to complete the OTA update procedure as there may be occasional failures or updates may need to be downloaded in multiple parts. We expect to provide another update in 24 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

Afterwards, we expect to see fewer OTA updates failing to complete despite multiple attempts to contact the OTA service. We have identified a fix for the issue that is preventing some Super SIMs from successfully updating to their latest settings via over-the-air (OTA) updates. The fix needs to be implemented at one of our downstream partners, who expect to begin releasing the update to impacted SIMs around 4pm UTC tomorrow, February 7th. Afterwards, we expect to see fewer OTA updates failing to complete despite multiple attempts to contact the OTA service. Please note that it may take more than one attempt for a SIM to complete the OTA update procedure as there may be occasional failures or updates may need to be downloaded in multiple parts. We expect to provide another update in 24 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

We are experiencing Super SIM Over the Air (OTA) update failures for some SIM cards. The issue is preventing Super SIMs from retrieving their latest OTA setting and optimizing connectivity for devices. We've identified a fix which will be going into testing as soon as possible. We will provide an update on Tuesday with the status of our fix.

We are experiencing Super SIM Over the Air (OTA) update failures for some SIM cards. affected_components.name: CARRIER NETWORK - SMS Short Code, North America

incidents.name: SMS Delivery Delays to Etisalat Network in Afghanistan

incident_updates.body: We are no longer experiencing MMS/SMS delivery delays when sending messages to Etisalat Network in Afghanistan. This incident has been resolved.

affected_components.name: CARRIER NETWORK - SMS, Middle East & Africa

incident_updates.body: We are observing recovery in MMS/SMS delivery delays when sending messages to Etisalat Network in Afghanistan. We will continue monitoring the service to ensure a full recovery. We will provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

affected_components.name: CARRIER NETWORK - SMS, Middle East & Africa

incident_updates.body: We are still experiencing SMS delivery delays when sending messages to Etisalat network in Afghanistan. Our engineers are working with our carrier partner to resolve the issue. We will provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

incidents.name: Association of Phone Numbers to Elastic SIP Trunk Fail in Twilio Console

incident_updates.body: The failure of the association of phone numbers to an Elastic SIP Trunk in the Twilio Console has been resolved and the Twilio Console is operating normally at this time.

We continue investigating the failure of the association of phone numbers to an Elastic SIP Trunk in the Twilio Console. Please use the REST API to associate Phone Numbers to your Elastic SIP Trunk. We expect to provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

We are investigating the failure of the association of phone numbers to an Elastic SIP Trunk in the Twilio Console. Please use the REST API to associate Phone Numbers to your Elastic SIP Trunk. We expect to provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.
Our monitoring systems have detected a potential issue with Phone Numbers. Our engineering team has been alerted and is actively investigating. We will update as soon as we have more information.
